project.teaser: The main objectives of the proposed project are to - Build and expand a core network of organisations engaged in mission-oriented policies mainly at national level, but closely tied to engaged policy actors at regional, local or thematic policy levels, as well as the European...
project.objective: The main objectives of the proposed project are to - Build and expand a core network of organisations engaged in mission-oriented policies mainly at national level, but closely tied to engaged policy actors at regional, local or thematic policy levels, as well as the European Commission as an active partner. - Promote a common vision of mission-oriented policy, and enable knowledge exchange, mutual learning and the testing of mutually compatible practices of mission governance. - Establish partnerships and cooperation with regional and local actors in order to guide and frame the initiatives of targeted mission hubs - Support these actors in setting up suitable governance structures aligning EU, national, regional/local levels of mission implementation.
project.title: Transnational cooperation on the missions approach

result.title: Missions playbook
result.description: Related to T3.4. The results from the knowledge exchange and mutual learning exercises will be collected and synthesized into a digital “playbook”, which will articulate a diverse range of different approaches for implementation of missions, each “tried and tested” in different mission-oriented innovation contexts. The playbook will describe thebackground to mission-oriented practices, detail diverse approaches and models, and provide clear and pragmatic guides to good practices, whilst discussing the potential pitfalls and cases that the mutual learning process has identified.

result.title: Knowledge Platform
result.description: Related to T4.4. A Knowledge Platform will be established aiming at providing an informative and interactive platform for all interested actors all over Europe and beyond. The Mission Data Platform (WP2) as well as the Mission Core Network (WP1) will be presented at the Knowledge Platform.

result.title: Approximately 10 knowledge exchange and mutual learning events conducted in several member states and associated countries
result.description: Related to T3.2. The mutual learning events consist of a series of workshops with different categories of participants and a range of foci that address different aspects of processes at national, regional and local level that may facilitate the implementation of missions. The workshops will address different topical issues of implementation at these levels (e.g., governance structures; design of national and regional programs; the inclusion of business and public sector; citizen participation, etc.), as well as the methods and approaches for conducting the workshops themselves.

result.title: Approximately three codeveloped use cases in several member states and associated countries
result.description: Related to T3.3. Use cases will exemplify and further develop the national, regional, or local missions’ implementation, or the set-up of complementary missions (engagement) actions at national, regional or local level. The subject of a use case may be to implement in practice the results of the mutual learning events (T3.2), but it may also originate from elsewhere, for example based on the input from the thematic missions CSA’s.

result.title: First draft of the MCN concept
result.description: Related to T1.1. Viable concept for the MCN and its internal operation, including terms of reference and criteria for membership. The concept will serve as a point of departure ensuring the functionality and utility of the MCN while safeguarding its sustainability and embedding the MCN in the European R&I landscape.

result.title: Mission data platform on policy interventions and policy actors/players
result.description: Related to T2.7. The development of online access interface will ensure the widespread use of the collected information on mission-oriented policies and actors/players in the EU. Furthermore, this development will also include a design for continuous improvement and an updating process, as well as incentives for the identified community (see WP1, WP3 or WP4), to contribute information on actors and activities to the repository.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - TRAMI (Transnational cooperation on the missions approach)
result.teaser: In recent years, research and innovation policy has been increasingly challenged to contribute to addressing societal ambitions. The perceived urgency of these challenges and the lack of satisfaction with the current set of policy approaches and instruments led to the recent...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Mapping analysis report
result.description: Related to T2.6. The mapping analysis report will provide an overview of mapping results and will summarize the outcomes of T2.2, T2.3, T2.4, and T2.5. This analytical report will also serve to highlight good practices in mission-oriented policy and hence will provide input for WP1 and WP3 respectively for their tasks devoted to in-depth learning and mutual exchange.

result.title: MCN Final Concept
result.description: MCN Final Concept is related to T1.3: including governance structures and vision. The final concept will help to ensure the sustainability and operability of the MCN after the end of the project.

result.title: Approaches for mutual learning events - toolbox
result.description: Related to T3.1. The purpose is to create generic approaches and materials that can be utilized in T3.2 workshops but also in other activities engaging national and regional actors during and after the lifespan of TRAMI. The aim is to put in place an iterative Part B - Page 19process and a dynamic relationship between T3.1 and T3.2 in order to facilitate a “learning-by-doing-process” that develops the concepts of the mutual learning events, tests them in the actual events and then produces feedback for the development and update of approaches.

result.title: Survey report
result.description: Related to T2.4. The results of the survey will support WP1, 3 and 4 by providing an overview of the actors/players covered in the field to be addressed in their activities.

result.title: Analytical framework for the mapping of actors and policy instruments
result.description: Related to T2.1. Final analytical framework and a clearly defined selection process of what and whom to map. The other five missions-specific preparatory actions will be invited to collaborate with TRAMI on the development of joint concepts, definitions and classifications.

result.title: MCN Presentation Material
result.description: Related to T1.2. MCN Presentation Material (Power Point, month 4)

result.title: MCN report on the implementation of missions at national, regional and local
result.description: Related to T1.3. The collection and analysis of already established governance structures and implementation processes at national, regional and local level will finally be published in a report. The report will include recommendations for efficient and effective mission implementation structures and processes.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
